title: A must see!
text: The most famous monument in Athens, has a magnificent view and aura once you have climbed up. It is truly magnificent and mustn’t be missed by anyone visiting Athens!

title: Standing on history
text: Don’t miss it! A must see for anyone traveling to Athens! Once on the rock, and walking among the remains you feel you are standing on the history of this land!

title: The museum to see in Athens
text: A remarkable effort to support the most famous monument in Athens! Spectacular items and views of the Parthenon situated opposite! Don’t miss it if you are in town!

title: Church
text: So impressive a must visit! Recently renovated itt surprises you pleasantly when you enter and impresses you with the inside!
place: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood

title: Crown plaza
text: Located very centrally has an unbeatable advantage! We enjoyed our stay there and would choose to stay there again! Although it’s location we were not bothered by noise and were close to the metro, buses and taxis.

title: Purée
text: A different, warm, cozy homy environment with friendly faces! The chandeliers make all the difference!

title: Red Square
text: It has so much to see so give it time. Combine with the Armoury, the fund reserve, the tomb of the unknown soldier, and the Farberge museum, After having seen it all, you can enjoy opposite their mall called Gum.

title: Sapsan
text: We flew to Moscow and travelled to Saint Petersburg with the Sapsan. It was comfortable, on time, and gives you the opportunity to enjoy the vast landscapes as you travel! We did it in winter and as you travel you get to see real Russia.

title: Bolshoi
text: Even without a ticket, walk around it. It is a historical renowned theater with such history. If you can afford a ticket, don’t miss it!

title: The Armory
text: So much history and incredible wealth found here! It is in a beautiful building, with must see items !

title: Moscow metro
text: safe and easy to use, when you arrive at the station you are taken by the beautiful statues, it’s grandness and its cleanliness!

title: Must see
text: Such a well known site, outside the Kremlin is a must see! It was very cold the day we visited and although we feared cues, it was well organized

title: A place to visit
text: Lovely restaurant with a secret garden where you can have wonderful tasty food, located in a must visit museum!!!

title: A “must” see for anyone traveling to Athens!
text: One of the newest museums in Athens, with extraordinary exhibits! A must see for anyone visiting Athens! It is located oposite the Parthenon, in a new building accessible to all. If you have the time, it has a very good restaurant!

title: An emotional and moving museum to visit!
text:
It was an emotional experience visiting this moving museum. It is a must if you are in the area visiting
Ground zero and the memorial!

title: Pick up service from airport
text: The cars aren’t as presented in the advertisement, but they are a great solution when you come off a long flight, are tired and jet lagged! Drivers are very friendly, eager to answer questions, and helpful!
place: New York Airports to Hotel: Shared Arrival Transfer

title: Shouldn’t miss it!
text: We chose to see the skyline as the sun was setting, and it was a memorable and incredible sight seeing! As it turned to dark we witnessed a photo shoot, and a marriage proposal! The fact that on the top floor there are no windows permits you to take the best photos ever! Bonus the photo they take of you, like the workers when it was built! A must do when in NY

title: It is enormous!
text: We got off the hop on hop off bus after circling it and walked inside. It is vast with different sceneries and play parks! Friendly hungry squirrels are everywhere, bands playing in different areas, athletes running, children playing, and so much more are the daily activities going on inside it. Can’t have seen NY without setting foot inside it!

title: What a Cathedral!
text: We actually visited it twice, as it was so impressive, and on the saturdays they had weddings taking place! It is such a beautiful and impressive cathedral, and listening to the organ play was amazing! It has a history of its own, and it is worth the stop and visit, no matter your religion!

title: It was clean
text: I found the personnel to be Kind and friendly, always eager to help. It is located centrally and it has a super market within walking distance. The rooms are basic but are clean and tidy! Bathrooms have been renovated.
